ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Music skills, techniques
I learned skills in violin and performing. I was able to learn a lot of new repertoire and how to improve myself as a musician.
PIANO
learned to not take too much time / have more direction in phrasing
Enhance piano technique and musical understanding plus much new repertoire
Improved my musicality, my fundamentals, and my understanding of reedmaking.
Piano performance

I learned to prioritize the big picture more as well as the smaller details when learning a piece. While the small details are important, I often get too obsessed with them and forget about the end goal of learning a piece.
Over the past semester, I have improved so much my tone quality and sound production.
Breathing and sound production techniques for classical singing, but that can also be applied to all musical styles and genres. Studied challenging and fun-to-perform repertoire in various languages.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths- able to continue music education

One of the strengths of this course is the constant feedback you get from your professor. I was able to improve a lot as a result. Studio classes also gave me the opportunity to practice performing. I cannot think of any weaknesses for this course.
INCREDIBLE
No improvement, this is why I came to Yale

One-on-one vocal instruction is extremely valuable and, in my opinion, the best way to improve your overall vocal health and technique. I was challenged by the repertoire I studied, and 10 lessons was just the right amount to prepare for jury. I would have liked to explore other songs outside of the three I prepared for jury, but the continual close study of each of those three songs each week helped me improve in more nuanced ways.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're singing with Janna, yes. She's great.
Of course

I would recommend this course if you qualify for lessons. I was able to learn so much and improve myself as a musician. I was able to choose repertoire I loved learning, and I really liked being able to learn about music on a deep level every week.
YES JUST DO IT
absolutely
Yes if you get lessons you should of course take them
Yes! Always good to get better at your instrument.
If you're serious at pursuing conservatory-level lessons with amazing professors, yes.
Yes! I love taking lessons.
Yes, Wendy Sharp is a wonderful violin professor and mentor.
Absolutely! Especially to a student who is involved in theater or a vocal performance group. It's so important to sharpen your vocal technique to make sure you're producing sound in a healthy way.
